info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 1:16PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Transylvania, south central Henderson, northwestern Greenville and northeastern Pickens Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 116 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Brevard, or near Dupont State Forest, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pleasant Ridge State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Jones Gap State Park, Dupont State Forest, Slater-Marietta, Pumpkintown, Little River In Transylvania County, Cleveland, Cedar Mountain and Connestee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
